info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:41AM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Huron, Tuscola, Sanilac, Shiawassee, Genesee, Lapeer, Livingston, Oakland and Washtenaw Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the Friday evening commute. Gusty winds may bring down snow covered tree branches resulting in scattered power outages. Blowing snow may reduce visibilities to below one mile at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy wet snow is expected this afternoon and evening. Peak snowfall rates of up to one inch per hour are possible before snow changes over to rain as temperatures rise into the mid 30s this evening. Very strong winds are expected late tonight into Saturday with gusts of up to 50 mph as arctic air filters in behind the system sending wind chill values close to zero. This will cause any residual moisture on roadways to freeze tonight, and additional snow showers will contribute to slick conditions through Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
